channel.title: Introduction on et cetera
channel.description: Recent content in Introduction on et cetera

item.title: Generate and deploy website
item.description: Generate static website using Hugo # prepare Hugo # download binary or use a package management system create repo and add theme # hugo new site my-blog # version control for original blog content git init # add theme repo as submodule git add submodule https://github.com/alex-shpak/hugo-book themes/hugo-book configuration # baseURL = 'https://wineinlib.github.io' languageCode = 'en-us' title = 'et cetera' theme = 'hugo-book' # (Optional) Set this to true to enable 'Last Modified by' date and git author # information on 'doc' type pages.

item.title: git
item.description: submodule # # add submodule git submodule add https://github.com/wineinlib/wineinlib.github.io.git public # sync git submodule update --init --recursive # remove rm -rf public rm -rf .git/modules/public git rm --cached public

item.title: linux commands
item.description: ssh # # specify port ssh -p 2200 scp # sshpass #

item.title: linux notes
item.description: init system # Ubuntu: use Systemd as default since 15.04 use upstart before # check init system used if which systemctl &>/dev/null then echo "init system: systemd" elif [[ "`ps -p1 | grep systemd && echo systemd || echo upstart`" = "upstart" ]] then echo "init system: upstart" else echo "init system not supported (upstart and systemd supported)" exit 1 fi systemd # upstart # description "my-app" respawn console output chdir ${app-dir} exec ${app-dir}/my-app --port=${port}

item.title: rsync
item.description: user and group mapping # rsync --numeric-ids --usermap="0:1000000,10:1000010" --groupmap="0:1000000,10:1000010" ... rsync over ssh # rsync -e 'ssh -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no' ...
